intro: Geum × convallis, commonly known as the everlasting peony, is a hybrid perennial plant that belongs to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, semi-double to double flowers that range in color from white to pink, red, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and produces foliage that is dark green and slightly hairy. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. The plant is native to China and has been widely cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
